Key Findings: Greater blood pressure reductions were observed in participants aged 46–65 years, those training more than twice per week, and individuals with existing comorbidities.
paper title: Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis of Football Training for Blood Pressure Management

Population: Mixed population including adolescents and older adults
Key Findings: Football training induced notable improvements in cardiac morphology and function, reflected by significant increases in ejection fraction and E/A ratio.
paper title: Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis of Football Training for Blood Pressure Management

Population: Adults with hypertension
Key Findings: Recreational football training resulted in mean reductions of -6.67 mmHg in systolic and -1.20 mmHg in diastolic values.
